sailpoint.object

Class QueryOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.object.QueryOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class QueryOptions
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used to specify options to a database query.

      • setOrderBy

        public QueryOptions setOrderBy(java.lang.String name)
        Convenience method to set order ascending by a single column. This will throw an exception if there is more than one ordering or there is a single ordering that already has a property name. Left for backwards compatibility.

      • setOrderAscending

        public QueryOptions setOrderAscending(boolean b)
        Convenience method to set whether to order ascending or descending. This will throw an assertion error if there are multiple orderings. Left for backwards compatibility.

      • addOrdering

        public QueryOptions addOrdering(java.lang.String name,
                                boolean ascending)
        Add an ordering to these QueryOptions. These will be applied in the order in which they are added.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property to order by.
        ascending - Whether to order ascending or descending.

      • isIdentitySearch

        public java.lang.String isIdentitySearch()
        Convenience method to determine if this represents a query for a specific object using the "id" or attribute. Used by some special persistence managers to convert a filter search into a getObject(id) call.

      • setDistinct

        public void setDistinct(boolean b)

      • isDistinct

        public boolean isDistinct()

      • setIgnoreCase

        @Deprecated
public void setIgnoreCase(boolean b)
        Deprecated. 
        Automatically makes all Filters case insensitive, where it makes sense. This is an alternative to using Filter.ignoreCase wrapper on individual filter terms.

        Starting in 7.1 this is deprecated, you should be letting the persistence layer automatically determine what is case insensitive and what isn't. Use of this option was always debatable since there is no assurance that everything in the filter had a case insensitive index.

      • isIgnoreCase

        public boolean isIgnoreCase()

      • getScopeResults

        public java.lang.Boolean getScopeResults()
        Return whether to scope results. If this returns null, this decision is deferred to the SailPointContext.
        Returns:
        Whether to scope results of the query or not. Can be null if the decision should be deferred to the SailPointContext.

      • setScopeResults

        public void setScopeResults(java.lang.Boolean scopeResults)
        Set whether or not to scope the results of this query based on the user's controlled scopes.

      • getUnscopedGloballyAccessible

        public java.lang.Boolean getUnscopedGloballyAccessible()
        Return whether unscoped objects should be returned or not for a scoped query. If not set, the scoping mechanism should default to the system configuration setting.

      • setUnscopedGloballyAccessible

        public void setUnscopedGloballyAccessible(java.lang.Boolean b)
        This can be set to override the system configuration setting for whether unscoped objects should be returned or not for a scoped query. If not set, this defaults to the system configuration setting.

      • extendScope

        public void extendScope(Filter... filters)
        Extend the result scope to include objects that match the given filter. This allows for things like allowing an identity to view all other identities that are in their scope as well as any identity for which they are the manager. Programmatically, this would be accomplished with: qo.setFilterResults(true); qo.extendScope(Filter.eq("manager", me));
        Parameters:
        filters - The Filter or Filters that describe the objects which should be returned in searches in addition to those that are in the user's controlled scopes.

      • addOwnerScope

        public void addOwnerScope(Identity user)
        Add a filter for default owner filtering. This filter includes all direct ownership AND ownership held by any workgroups assigned to the Identity. Programmatically, for a ui bean this would be accomplished with: qo.setScopeResults(true); qo.addOwnerScopeFilter(super.getLoggedInUser());

      • getOwnerScopeFilter

        public static Filter getOwnerScopeFilter(Identity user,
                                         java.lang.String ownerColumn)
        Return a filter for default owner filtering. This filter includes all direct ownership AND ownership held by any workgroups assigned to the Identity.

      • getOwnerScopeFilterUsingSubqueries

        public static Filter getOwnerScopeFilterUsingSubqueries(Identity user,
                                                        java.lang.String ownerColumn)
        Return a filter for default owner filtering. This filter includes all direct ownership AND ownership held by any workgroups assigned to the Identity. IIQMAG-2627: This is split from getOwnerScopeFilter so that we can get a query using the owner.id field which is needed by the full textifier for proper query conversion.

      • getScopeExtensions

        public java.util.List<Filter> getScopeExtensions()
        Return the Filters that describe the objects to be included in the query results in addition to those that are in the user's controlled scopes.
        Returns:
        The Filters that describe the objects to be included in the query results in addition to those that are in the user's controlled scopes, or null if there are no scope extensions.

      • setTransactionLock

        public void setTransactionLock(boolean b)
        Obtain a transaction lock on objects returned by non-projection queries. Note that searches that obtain persistent locks are not supported. It does not seem very useful to bulk lock a bunch of objects.

      • isTransactionLock

        public boolean isTransactionLock()

      • setQuery

        public void setQuery(java.lang.String q)
        Used to define a search expressed as HQL or SQL. The default is HQL, if you want to use SQL (which is discouraged) prefix the query with "sql:".

        This field will have priority over _filters if both are set.

      • getQuery

        public java.lang.String getQuery()

      • setCacheResults

        public void setCacheResults(boolean cache)
        When true, the consumer of these QueryOptions has the option to cache the results upon execution. This can improve performance in some cases, but can also add overhead with cache management.
        Parameters:
        cache - Whether to cache the query results upon execution.

      • isCacheResults

        public boolean isCacheResults()

      • setFlushBeforeQuery

        public void setFlushBeforeQuery(boolean flush)
        When true, the consumer of these QueryOptions will flush any non-saved data to the database before executing the query to ensure that an accurate set of results is returned.
        Parameters:
        flush - Whether to flush any non-saved data to the database before executing the query.

      • isFlushBeforeQuery

        public boolean isFlushBeforeQuery()
